Cool Down (5 minutes)

Complete the table using all of the exponent properties you learned in the lesson.

Exponent Property Review

Expression

Simplified Result

\(j^5 \cdot j^3\)

\(\frac{h^7}{h^3}\)

\((-ab)^0\)

\(\frac{1}{s^{-4}}\)

\((\frac{m}{n})^{-4}\)

\((p^5)^2\)

\((3s^3t^2)^3\)

\((\frac{b}{d})^{-2}\)

Answer:

Exponent Property Review

Expression

Simplified Result

\(j^5 \cdot j^3\)

\(j^8\)

\(\frac{h^7}{h^3}\)

\(h^4\)

\((-ab)^0\)

\(1\)

\(\frac{1}{s^{-4}}\)

\(s^4\)

\((\frac{m}{n})^{-4}\)

\(\frac{n^4}{m^4}\)

\((p^5)^2\)

\(p^{10}\)

\((3s^3t^2)^3\)

\(3^3s^9t^6 = 27s^9t^6\)

\((\frac{b}{d})^{-2}\)

\(\frac{d^2}{b^2}\)

Take some time to review each of the exponential properties you learned in the lesson. Look at each property and be sure you know when to use it.


SUMMARY OF EXPONENT PROPERTIES

If \(a\) and \(b\) are real numbers and \(m\) and \(n\) are integers, then

Property

Description

Product Property

\(a^m \cdot a^n={a^{m+n}}\)

Power Property

\((a^m)^n=a^{m·n}\)

Product to a Power

\((ab)^m=a^mb^m\)

Quotient Property

\(\frac{a^m}{a^n}=a^{m−n}\), \(a\neq0\)

Zero Exponent Property

\(a^0=1\), \(a\neq0\)

Quotient to a Power Property

\((\frac{a}{b})^m=\frac{a^m}{b^m}\), \(b\neq0\)

Properties of Negative Exponents

\(a^{−n}=\frac{1}{a^n}\) and \(\frac{1}{a^{−n}}=a^n\)

Quotient to a Negative Exponent

\((\frac{a}{b})^{−n}=(\frac{b}{a})^n\)
